title: Nels Crutchfield
text:
William Ian Nelson Crutchfield (July 12, 1911 — July 22, 1985), known as Nels Crutchfield, was a Canadian professional <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> player.
Born in <a href="Brome%20Lake%2C%20Quebec">Knowlton</a>, <a href="Quebec">Quebec</a>, he played <a href="Defenceman%20%28ice%20hockey%29">defence</a> and <a href="centre%20%28ice%20hockey%29">centre</a> for the <a href="McGill%20Redmen">McGill Redmen</a> from 1930 to 1934 and was team captain from 1933 to 1934. He received a <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Commerce">Bachelor of Commerce</a> degree in 1934. He played 41 games in the <a href="1934%E2%80%9335%20NHL%20season">1934–35 season</a> with the <a href="Montreal%20Canadiens">Montreal Canadiens</a>, recording 5 goals and 5 assists, with another assist in two playoff games that year. His career was cut short after receiving a fractured skull in a car accident in September 1935.
He died in another car accident in 1985 in <a href="Huntsville%2C%20Ontario">Huntsville, Ontario</a>.
Crutchfield was inducted into the <a href="McGill%20University%20Sports%20Hall%20of%20Fame">McGill University Sports Hall of Fame</a> in 2001.
